intro: Paepalanthus farinaceus, commonly known as the silky pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
